poem:
Title: The Surplus of Power  

In the empire of sums, behold Hunt,
Armoured in statistics, in surplus cloaks.
He holds aloft his balance book, a hunt 
for votes hidden in the sterling notes.

The common man, a ghost in governmental equations,
His worth reduced, but taxes tower.
Irrelevant in dealings of higher stations,
Where surplus signifies not hope, but power.
